item.title: Terrible Day of the Big Gundown
item.description: Terrible Day of the Big Gundown is a 1971 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Sergio Garrone.

item.title: My Name Is Shanghai Joe
item.description: The Fighting Fist of Shanghai Joe is a 1973 Spaghetti Western kung fu film directed by Mario Caiano and starring Chen Lee as Shanghai Joe. The film was released in a number of alternate titles in the United States, including To Kill or to Die and The Dragon Strikes Back.

item.title: Have a Good Funeral, My Friend... Sartana Will Pay
item.description: Have a Good Funeral, My Friend... Sartana Will Pay is a 1970 Spaghetti Western film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo, written by Roberto Gianviti and starring Gianni Garko.

item.title: They Call Me Trinity
item.description: They Call Me Trinity is a 1970 Italian Spaghetti Western comedy film written and directed by Enzo Barboni and produced by Italo Zingarelli. The film stars Terence Hill and Bud Spencer as two brothers, Trinity and Bambino, who help defend a Mormon settlement from Mexican bandits and the henchman of the land-grabbing Major Harriman. It was filmed on location in Lazio, Italy, with financial backing from West Film.

item.title: Return of Shanghai Joe
item.description: Return of Shanghai Joe is a 1975 Western film directed by Bitto Albertini and starring Klaus Kinski.

item.title: Chuck Moll
item.description: Chuck Moll is a 1970 Italian spaghetti western. The film represents the directorial debut of Enzo Barboni, who was, until then, a respected cinematographer. He replaced Ferdinando Baldi, who was fired by the producer Manolo Bolognini because of his insistence in wanting to engage the actress Annabella Incontrera in the role of Sheila.

item.title: Buddy Goes West
item.description: Buddy goes West is a 1981 Spaghetti Western comedy film directed by Michele Lupo.

item.title: Django – Der Tag der Abrechnung
item.description: Django – Der Tag der Abrechnung ist ein Italowestern von Sergio Garrone aus dem Jahr 1971. Deutschsprachige Erstaufführung war am 29. Juni 1989 im Privatfernsehen.

item.title: Der Mann mit der Kugelpeitsche
item.description: Der Mann mit der Kugelpeitsche ist ein Italowestern mit Elementen des Eastern-Genres, den Mario Caiano 1973 inszenierte. Die deutschsprachige Erstaufführung erfolgte in gekürzter Form am 11. Januar 1974. Alternativtitel sind Karate Jack, Mein Name ist Karate-Jack und Shanghai Joe, der Mann mit der Kugelpeitsche. Eine DVD-Veröffentlichung trug den Titel Knochenbrecher im Wilden Westen.

item.title: Sartana – noch warm und schon Sand drauf
item.description: Sartana – noch warm und schon Sand drauf ist ein Italowestern, der unter der Spielleitung von Giuliano Carnimeo 1970 entstand. Der mit Gianni Garko in der Titelrolle des schwarz gekleideten Titelhelden Sartana besetzte Film feierte seine Erstaufführung im deutschsprachigen Raum am 4. Juni 1971.
